question.title: How to set frameOptions in SpringSecurity outside of FilterChain (for example with WebSecurityCustomizer)?
question.body:
Our SecurityFilterChain is defined in internal library, and I need to set disable frameOptions for one project, like this:

@Bean
SecurityWebFilterChain springSecurityFilterChain(ServerHttpSecurity http) {
    http
        // ...
        .headers(headers -> headers
            .frameOptions(frameOptions -> frameOptions.disable()
            )
        );
    return http.build();
}

And while of course I could just make the change in the internal library, but that would change it for all client projects.

My other option would be to override and redefine the bean completely but that would involve duplicating quite a bit of code.

I was wondering if there is a way to achieve the same result (of disabling frameOptions) with WebSecurityCustomizer? Or some other way?

question_comments.body: Another option is to alter internal library, and put frame options from property value, with default enable, so it won't have effects on the rest of projects using it. And in your particular project, just override property (e.g. security.frame-options.enabled=false)
